alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 1:42AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Washita, central Custer and south central Dewey Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 142 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Putnam to 3 miles east of Butler to 5 miles southwest of Canute. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Cordell, Burns Flat, Arapaho, Canute, Butler, Bessie, Foss, Putnam, Foss Reservoir, and Stafford. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 44 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
